data.title: Washington OER and Low-Cost Labeling Policies
data.meta_description: Led by the Washington Community and Technical College Students Association (WACTCSA), with support from the Washington State Board for Community and Technical Colleges (SBCTC), the OER & Low-Cost Labeling Policies were legislated in 2020 (RCW 28B.50.789).
data.text:
About the Implementation Guide

The Washington Community and Technical College system has gone through four rounds of statewide studies in order to establish the policies that guide the labeling of courses with OER and Low-Cost materials. See a full list of the study reports.

These labeling policies are now instituted in the SBCTC coding manual and require colleges to identify courses accordingly. This guide provides Washingtonâ€™s community and technical colleges with practical implementation tools and a detailed overview of the labeling policies.

Start by reviewing the Comprehensive Labeling Guide.
